intro: Distictis arthrerion, commonly known as the narrow-leafed rock daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is relatively rare in cultivation.
